    Machel Reid

    Research Intern at the University of Tokyo working on natural language processing research

    • Email
    • Website
    • Twitter
    • Scholar

    Hi There! Name's Machel

    I’m a 16-year-old research intern at the University of Tokyo, working on NLP Research at Matsuo Lab advised by Professor Yutaka Matsuo. Here, I am currently working on ways to learn representations of edits and ways of editing documents, but I am also interested in/working on definitions, translation, and anything to do with deep generative models (like VAEs).

    I’m also an associate member at the Masason Foundation.

    Previously, I worked on a project for automation of helplines during natural disasters, during my internship at Numada Lab, The University of Tokyo, and even further back, I was part of the team that won the Rakuten Hackathon in 2018, being the youngest participant at age 14.

    Before entering the field of machine learning and computational linguistics, I worked for the Thomson Reuters Foundation as a researcher and participated in the conduction of two annual studies, and have this article (https://www.weforum.org/agenda/authors/machel-reid/) published in the World Economic Forum.

    News

    • I’m extremely grateful to be accepted as a 4th Generation Masason Foundation Scholar! - July 2020

    • Our paper: Variational Inference for Learning Representations of Natural Language Edits was accepted to the non-archival track of the 5th Workshop of Representation Learning for NLP at ACL 2020 - May 2020

    • Our paper: Combining Pretrained High Resource Embeddings and Subword Representations for Low-Resource Languages was accepted to the AfricaNLP Workshop at ICLR 2020 - March 2020
